name: rb
summary: The `<rb>` HTML element is used to delimit the base text component of a ruby annotation, i.e. the text that is being annotated. One `<rb>` element should wrap each separate atomic segment of the base text.
permittedContent: As a child of a ruby element.
tagOmission: The end tag can be omitted if the element is immediately followed by an rt, rtc, or rp element or another `<rb>` element, or if there is no more content in the parent element.
